p:
Data suggest that presymptomatic and asymptomatic individuals can also spread the virus. Like other respiratory pathogens, the transmission of COVID-19 occurs through aerosol droplets from coughing and sneezing.
1, 2 The incubation period for the virus is generally within 3 to 7 days but could be as long as 14 days.
6 Also, the R 0 seems now to be quite different from what it has been calculated originally (2.2-2.7). The primary reproductive number, R 0, relies on the exponential growth rate of an outbreak, as well as additional factors, such as the latent period and the infectious period. Most recently, Sanche et al. found R 0 is likely to be 5.7 with a broad 95% CI (3.8-8.9).
12 This value may better explain the pandemic spread than a R 0 of approximately 2.5.
